title: Ticket #2818: schedd dslot claiming does not respect +AccountingGroup
description:
Config: 
NUM_CPUS=40
SLOT_TYPE_1 = cpus=$(NUM_CPUS)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1
SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE=TRUE

########################################################
## Test for STATIC Quota
GROUP_NAMES = group_one, group_two
GROUP_QUOTA_group_one = 4
GROUP_QUOTA_group_two = 4

Submission: 

executable=/bin/sleep
arguments=300

+AccountingGroup = "group_one.user"

queue 40

Results: 

Negotiator hands out a claim, schedd chugs a way at the paritionable slot->dslot w/o respect for static quota
remarks:
2012-Feb-13 15:07:33 by tannenba:
Should work the same as if the partitionable slot was configured as a static slot with respect to accounting group quotas. Tim will confirm this is "the truth" as the first step...

2012-Feb-14 09:11:31 by tstclair:
works only when NEGOTIATOR_USE_SLOT_WEIGHTS = True, so it seems logical to change CLAIM_PARTITIONABLE_LEFTOVERS default to "$(NEGOTIATOR_USE_SLOT_WEIGHTS)"

2012-Feb-14 09:17:35 by tstclair:
There is a new issue which has been found, but I'll create a new ticket for that.
